alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 14 at 2:50PM EDT until October 14 at 11:49PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Ammonoosuc River At Bethlehem affecting Grafton County. For the Ammonoosuc River...including Bethlehem...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ammonoosuc River at Bethlehem. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins along River Road in the vicinity of Black Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 8.1 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM EDT.
